text:
For content (not SEO) I'll usually have an hourly and per-word rate, then blend them where needed. If an article comes down the line and there's scant info, and I have to develop the concept/thesis from a few loose thoughts, then all that process is charged hourly, plus a per-word cost for the final piece. I usually include at least one round of revision built into the process, so if a 700 word draft shrinks to 550 words, I bill against the latter.

For short pieces, like tweets, I'll usually either forgo per word and only do hourly.

Editing is also per word, but you could try the blend and charge a different rate for editing vs writing if you want.
